soc.client

Class UserPreferences

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.client.UserPreferences

  • public class UserPreferences
extends java.lang.Object
    Gathered static methods to use persistent user preferences if available, or defaults if not.

    Before v2.0.00 these methods were in SOCPlayerClient itself. Method names are simplifed to prevent redundancy: v1.x getUserPreference(..) -> v2.x UserPreferences.getPref(..), etc.

    Because the user preference storage namespace is based on the soc.client package and not a class name, preferences are shared among all JSettlers client versions.

    Is public for possible use by anyone extending JSettlers in a different package.

    Since:
    2.0.00
    Author:
    Jeremy D Monin <jeremy@nand.net>

    • Method Detail

      • getPref

        public static boolean getPref(java.lang.String prefKey,
                              boolean dflt)
        Get a boolean persistent user preference if available, or the default value.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was getUserPreference.

        Parameters:
        prefKey - Preference name key, such as SOCPlayerClient.PREF_SOUND_ON
        dflt - Default value to get if no preference, or if prefKey is null
        Returns:
        Preference value or dflt
        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        putPref(String, boolean), getPref(String, int)

      • getPref

        public static int getPref(java.lang.String prefKey,
                          int dflt)
        Get an int persistent user preference if available, or the default value.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was getUserPreference.

        Parameters:
        prefKey - Preference name key, such as SOCPlayerClient.PREF_BOT_TRADE_REJECT_SEC
        dflt - Default value to get if no preference, or if prefKey is null
        Returns:
        Preference value or dflt
        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        putPref(String, int), getPref(String, boolean)

      • putPref

        public static void putPref(java.lang.String prefKey,
                           boolean val)
                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set a boolean persistent user preference, if available. Asynchronously calls Preferences.flush().

        Before v2.0.00 this method was putUserPreference.

        Parameters:
        prefKey - Preference name key, such as SOCPlayerClient.PREF_SOUND_ON
        val - Value to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if prefKey is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if prefKey is longer than Preferences.MAX_KEY_LENGTH
        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        getPref(String, boolean), putPref(String, int), clear(String)

      • putPref

        public static void putPref(java.lang.String prefKey,
                           int val)
                    throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                           java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Set an int persistent user preference, if available. Asynchronously calls Preferences.flush().

        Before v2.0.00 this method was putUserPreference.

        Parameters:
        prefKey - Preference name key, such as SOCPlayerClient.PREF_BOT_TRADE_REJECT_SEC
        val - Value to set
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if prefKey is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if prefKey is longer than Preferences.MAX_KEY_LENGTH
        Since:
        1.2.00
        See Also:
        getPref(String, int), putPref(String, boolean), clear(String)

      • clear

        public static void clear(java.lang.String prefKeyList)
        Clear some user preferences by removing the value stored for their key(s). (Calls Preferences.remove(String), not Preferences.clear()). Calls Preferences.flush() afterwards. Prints a "Cleared" message to System.err with prefKeyList.

        Before v2.0.00 this method was clearUserPreferences.

        Parameters:
        prefKeyList - Preference name key(s) to clear, same format as SOCPlayerClient.PROP_JSETTLERS_DEBUG_CLEAR__PREFS. Does nothing if null or "". Keys on this list do not all have to exist with a value; key name typos will not throw an exception.
        Since:
        1.2.00
